result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandy Lee Thundercloud-Eary was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or combination of both
Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine/costs paid in full within 24 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandy Lee Thundercloud-Eary in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.  Court has no concerns of travel to Columbia providing accompanied by parents and complies with probation. 

Count 1:
2 years Probation
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Full time employment or schooling or combination of both
May be Expunged after probation completed and costs paid in full
$518.00 Costs & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court

Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-17-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Brandy Lee Thundercloud-Eary in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smith states matter is he has spoken to ADA Hoffman but just got another offer today.  Requests time to consider that.  Requests plea/sent date be set.  Court instructs Atty Smith to talk to his assistant today before he leaves and JT is taken off.  Bond continued.

Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial Br. 1.  Bond continues.

Defendant Brandy Lee Thundercloud-Eary in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith advises of waiver today.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Proceed to argn.
Preliminary hearing on April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smith explains why DE isn't here today as she has been excused from Court until after graduation out of state this spring.  Requests continuance/has spoken to ADA Hoffman and she is awaiting some more information.  Provides new address for DE.  State doesn't agree to lengthy reset as requested by Atty Smith.  Atty Smith responds/time limits cont'd waived for prelim.  State requests DE be required to appear on her spring break.  Court sets matter for prelim.  Court advises Atty Smith to let the Court know if there is a problem w/that date for any reason.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
